title: Before Sunday's march, President Macron condemns 'unbearable resurgence of unbridled anti-Semitism' in France
summary: Emmanuel Macron said on Saturday, in French daily 'Le Parisien' that 'great civic march' should show France as 'united behind its values, its universalism.' France has recorded nearly 12,250 anti-Semitic acts since the October 7 Hamas attack in Israel.

title: Tensions run high in Israeli war cabinet leading operations in Gaza
summary: This five-member body, which led Israel's response to the Hamas attacks on October 7, is caught up in governmental dissension.

title: Netanyahu pushes back againts calls for cease-fire as Israel battles Hamas outside main Gaza hospital
summary: Israel's PM also rejected the idea that the Palestinian Authority, which currently administers autonomous areas in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, would at some stage control Gaza.

title: On the border between Peru and Bolivia, Lake Titicaca is suffering from historic drought
summary: The transboundary lake, the highest freshwater lake in the world on which 3 million people depend, has receded by up to 2 kilometers in some spots. The cause: An exceptional rain deficit and the impact of deforestation in the Amazon.

title: The race to repatriate Bogdan Ermokhin, an orphan from Mariupol deported to Russia
summary: The young Ukrainian will turn 18 on November 19. His cousin and his lawyer are fighting for his return, fearing that when he comes of age he will be drafted against his will into the Russian army.

title: Pope Francis removes a leading conservative critic as bishop of Tyler, Texas
summary: It is rare for the pope to remove a bishop from office. Earlier this year, the Vatican sent in investigators to look into his governance of the diocese, amid reports that he was making unorthodox claims.

title: 'Whether it be the Russian-Ukrainian or the Israel-Hamas conflict, the problem is the same: there is no 'international community' capable of imposing a resolution'
summary: With the US on the defensive, and China and Russia proclaiming an anti-American international order, the UN Security Council is paralyzed, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: At Riyadh summit, Arab and Muslim leaders slam Israel, but can't agree on response
summary: The final declaration on Saturday rejected Israeli claims that it is acting in 'self-defense' and demanded that the United Nations Security Council adopt 'a decisive and binding resolution' to halt Israel's 'aggression.'

title: London pro-Palestinian march passes off peacefully but police clash with far-right counter-protesters
summary: The march was apparently the largest in London since the start of the conflict, with 300,000 people according to the police snaking through the city from Hyde Park to the US Embassy.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Gulf countries try not to get caught in US-Iran face-off
summary: The war triggered by the Hamas attack on October 7 prompted Saudi Arabia to step up its dialogue with Tehran without calling into question the normalization of its relations with Israel.

title: Australia responds to 'cyber incident' affecting ports
summary: The incident impacts several ports operated by DP World Australia and could last several days.

title: 21% of France's immigrants have been, at some point, undocumented
summary: According to a study, less than half of the immigrants who arrived on French territory did so illegally. This phenomenon appears to have been stable over the years, invalidating the right and far-right allegation of a migratory 'submersion.'

title: Life under Sharia law in Banda Aceh, Indonesia
summary: The province of Aceh, in the north of the island of Sumatra, is the only one in the country to apply Quranic law. The residents of its capital have made it a marker of their identity.

title: Paris tests dismantling of iconic bookstalls ahead of 2024 Olympics ceremony
summary: On Friday, four secondhand bookstalls on the banks of the Seine will be dismantled and reassembled to test whether they can be moved in July 2024, before the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games on the Seine.

title: Why is Northern France hit by exceptional floods?
summary: According to France's national weather service, the total rainfall in the Pas-de-Calais region over the last three weeks has been almost 250 millimeters.

title: In Belgium, scandal arise around massive PFAS water pollution
summary: Public authorities and the water distribution company Société Zallonne de Distribution des Eaux were informed of contamination with perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl compounds – but consistently downplayed the risks it posed.

title: Isabelle Adjani releases second album after 40 years
summary: The 'Pull Marine' singer unveiled 'Bande Originale,' conceived by Pascal Obispo alongside an all-male accompaniment.

title: Photojournalists 'embedded' with Hamas on October 7: Heavy but unsubstantiated Israeli accusations
summary: Israeli officials accused photographers working for foreign media outlets of having 'known about the massacre,' echoing the claim of a pro-Israeli advocacy group, which has since backtracked.

title: At the Pole Summit, Emmanuel Macron hones his climate diplomacy ahead of COP28
summary: After tough negotiations, 32 countries signed the 'Paris Call for Glaciers and Poles' on Friday, expressing alarm at the situation of polar ice caps and explaining that 200,000 glaciers are threatened with 'almost irreversible retreat.'

title: Are abortion rights under threat in France?
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron has said he wants to enshrine women's 'freedom' to have an abortion in the French constitution by 2024.

title: Pedro Sánchez wins support of Catalan separatists with concessions that inflame Spain
summary: To retain his position, the Socialist Prime Minister has signed an agreement with Carles Puigdemont's Junts party toward a controversial amnesty law. The People's Party (PP, right-wing) has called for demonstrations in Madrid and all provincial capitals on Sunday.

title: Inside the kitchens of migrant women in Tunisia
summary: Léna, Nathalie, Rebecca and Marcelle fight every day to create new prospects for themselves, despite the hardships, the Covid crisis, inflation and waves of racist violence. They are caught between the desire to stay in Tunis and homesickness.

title: Myanmar junta attempts to attract tourists in a quest to bring in foreign currency
summary: Tourist operators in France are readily promoting a country under military dictatorship rule since the coup d'état of February 1, 2021.

title: Five waterside restaurants in Paris and the Ile-de-France region
summary: On the banks of the Marne or the Canal de l'Ourcq, on a terrace with a view or in the shade of a large oak tree, you'll find reimagined classics and chef's surprises.

title: Biodiversity: EU to adopt nature restoration law
summary: Member states and the European Parliament agreed on Thursday to a bill that calls for the restoration of 30% of damaged ecosystems by 2030. According to EU data, over 80% of natural habitats are in poor condition.

title: At 17, Ruth Orkin set out on her bike to photograph America
summary: In 1939, traveled the United States, refining her art from Los Angeles to New York. Some 40 photographs taken on this journey are on display at the Henri Cartier-Bresson Foundation in Paris.

title: Arab and Muslim countries united to call for Gaza ceasefire
summary: However, differences between Middle East leaders are preventing the articulation of a common vision for ending the war and imagining 'what comes after.'

title: In Senegal, wigs are 'locks of gold,' coveted by thieves
summary: Thefts of hairpieces, which can be worth hundreds of euros, are on the rise in Dakar.

title: Hundreds of dual nationals leave war-torn Gaza as evacuations through Egypt resume
summary: Since November 1, dozens of wounded Palestinians have also been evacuated to Egyptian hospitals through the Rafah border crossing.

title: Displaced Gazans lack everything in overcrowded UNRWA shelters
summary: Around 50 UN agency buildings have been hit by Israeli bombardments in Gaza and around 66 people were killed.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'It's time for Western countries to take the BRICS seriously'
summary: In his column, the French economist argues that a minimum tax should be introduced on the world's most prosperous players, with a redistribution of revenues between all countries, to share power and wealth.
